_inspectorSnowReport.Report:
January 24th, 1:20 PM
Good afternoon riders and skiers! The day has come, the infamous Arctic front has arrived along with 2 inches of new wind-blown snow. Temperatures have plunged into the negatives, settling in the negative teens at the summit and negative single-digits at the base for today. With strong winds, it will feel significantly colder due to wind chill. Tomorrow's forecast calls for cloudy skies with afternoon snow, bringing 2 or more inches. Temperatures will rise slightly to low singles at the base and hover around 0 at the summit. Cold got you down? Shake it off, because a powder day is charging in! Were expecting 12 or more inches of fresh snow from Sunday evening into Monday, and its shaping up to be an alltime kind of storm. Start packing your bags, waxing your boards, and tuning those skis. This is one of those days you clear your schedule for. Dont miss it! 

Were skiing and riding across 484 acres, served by 15 lifts and 111 open trails, with 43 trails freshly groomed overnight. Today, enjoy beautiful firm groomers alongside packed powder conditions across the mountain. Check out Gate House terrain to find some sun-soaked groomers today. Due to cold temperatures, Slide Brook will not be operating today or tomorrow. All natural terrain is recommended for experts only, as conditions remain variable. If the cold isnt your cup of tea, Sugarbush offers plenty of alternative activities. Warm up with a cozy meal at one of our many onresort restaurants, or head over to the SHARC for a variety of indoor activities. Tomorrow, the trail Inverness will be closed to the public for racing events.

Operations are back in weekend hours. GMX, Super Bravo, and Heaven's Gate will kick things off with an 8:00 AM load, followed by all other scheduled lifts at 9:00 AM. Sugarbush continues to deliver freestyle fun for all levels. At Mt. Ellen, youll find over 80 features on Riemergasse and another 27 features on Sugar Run, all served by the iconic Sunny Quad. At Lincoln Peak, Slowpoke has been refreshed with 10 new features, with more on the way, and 7 creative features remain on Sugarbear Forest. Join us for the Cold Steel Rail Jam this afternoon in the Mt. Ellen Base Area! Come shred some awesome rails and take your shot at winning great prizes from 2:005:00 PM, with registration open from 12:002:00 PM. Stick around after the event for live music from The Detonators, keeping the energy high from 6:309:30 PM. Cold temps, hot laps, and aprs vibes, dont miss it!

Play Blizzard Bingo all month long! As part of NSAA Safety Month, ski, ride, and learn across Sugarbush throughout January. Stop by the Creation Station, located across from Guest Services at Lincoln Peak or Mount Ellen, to create your safety-themed poster. Todays safety tip: Hands to Yourself. Fun for all ages, join us this January for an unforgettable Safety Month, and dont forget to check out all of our winter events.

All uphill travel routes are open at both Lincoln Peak and Mt. Ellen. Please review our Uphill Travel Policy for full details. *The trails Cliffs, Tumbler, and Hammerhead will be closed for both up and downhill travel due to grooming tonight*
